lines: Control: Commander Hale, we're reading you. The rover's telemetry is gone. Report.
Hale: The engine... it's dead. Fuel leak. I'm over 1000km from the ship.
Control: Understood. Your food supplies won't last. You have no choice but to go on foot.
Control: We've analyzed the terrain data. We have two potential routes for you. Listen carefully.

choices.text: Proceed to the ridge, northeast of your position.
Walk towards the large crater to the northwest.

lines: Control: You're heading for the ridge. It will be a hard climb, but it offers a high vantage point.
Hale: Copy that. Beginning my ascent... The rocks are loose here... I'm up. I can see something from here.
Hale: Down in the crater... it looks like a campsite.

choices.text: Too risky. Return to the rover.

lines: Control: You're heading directly for the crater. Be cautious, we have no data on this area.
Hale: I'm approaching the crater rim... I see it. There's a makeshift campsite below. The fire's still hot, but... there's no one here. It's silent.

choices.text: This is a bad idea. Go back.

lines: Hale: I've reached the campsite. It's eerie. Tents are set up, but supplies are scattered everywhere. This place was abandoned in a hurry.

choices.text: Search the tents for anything useful.
Report back to Control and leave.

lines: Hale: I'm turning back. This doesn't feel right.
Control: Commander, we advise against this. Your resources are critical.
Hale: The walk is... harder than I thought. The sun... so hot...
Control: Commander? Commander Hale, do you copy?!
...Signal Lost...
Hale: I'm searching the tents. Found some tools, a ration pack... it's half-eaten.
Hale: Wait... I heard something. A metallic clang, just outside.

choices.text: Go check it out. Be ready for anything.

lines: Hale: Hiding. I'm in one of the tents, behind some crates.
Hale: I hear voices... multiple. They don't sound... right. Guttural.
Hale: I'm peeking through a tear in the tent... I see someone. Another astronaut. But his suit is torn, and his skin... it's cracked, broken. He's not alone.
Hale: Moving to check the sound. Cautiously.
Hale: I'm rounding a large rock formation... There's someone here.
Hale: It's another astronaut. Suit's damaged, he looks gaunt... exhausted. He's raising his hand... I don't think it's a threat. I think he needs help.
